TopicTitle: The Unofficial Kerbal Space Program Forum Steam Group

Articles.Content:
So, you can buy KSP on Steam and share screenshots with other people. You can also easily chat with them using the Shift + Tab - Overlay.

Which is why I opened this thread.

A few months later: We now got a group and there are usually a few active people to chat with in the group chat. Feel free to join and have fun!

If you want me to add you to the Steam group, post a link to your profile here so I can send you a friend request.

If you don't want to post your name here, add me, my name is Volcanix.

After I added you, just write me a message and I will invite you to the group.

When you are in the group, feel free to introduce yourself in the 'Forum' and join the group chat. It allows realtime answers for questions!

Important note: When you enter the chat for the first time you can't see anything that's been said before you arrived. It may look like nothing's going on so just say hello. There are pauses in our conversations but it's pretty lively.

Oh and by the way, there are usually more people in our chat than in the chat of the official KSP Steam group, which consists of about 10.000 (online) players at the moment.

Edited January 18, 2015 by Volcanix

EDIT: The_Avera9e_Joe

Alright everyone, i am going to ask you to put your steam things like this:

www.steamcommunity.com/id/PUTIDHERE

Make sure you use you community profile name and not your Steam ID (i.e. the name you log in with). Your Steam ID should be private. If you don't have one go to Steam -> Settings and click on the Friends tab. There should also be a way to create your custom url as kenbob mentioned above. You don't automatically have one.
